humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that one sentinel lymph node (specimen A) is positive for metastatic carcinoma with the largest focus measuring 0.4 cm, and one non-sentinel lymph node (specimen B) is completely replaced by metastatic carcinoma measuring 1.5 cm. This information supports the N1 stage, as it indicates metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes (N1) based on the provided rules.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient has metastatic carcinoma in one sentinel lymph node (largest focus measuring 0.4 cm) and one non-sentinel lymph node (completely replaced by metastatic carcinoma, measuring 1.5 cm). This information corresponds to a pathologic N stage of N1 (pN1a) in the TNM staging system.
